review_title: Great company doing such worthwhile work
job_title: Head of Marketing (Contract) in Banbury, England
pros: Nice mix of people - all very clever in their fields.  Lots of work WRAP do is not realised - the recycling logo, condensing aerosol sprays, reducing waste and maximising resources.  Friendly people and caring management.
cons: Deciding which bin to put your sandwich packet in!  They take recycling seriously - which is a good thing.  I worked as a contractor and can say I really enjoyed working with WRAP.

review_title: Good Intentions – Need to be more realistic
pros: The majority of the time it is the people at WRAP that make the place. Good social atmosphere Varied and interesting work subjects
cons: Senior level management can be often invisible or not empathetic enough The organisation is expanding but the level of people that are delivering is not. leading to a top heavy organisation. Too many cooks! The workload – it is addressed each year and still remains unsustainable for most with many people regularly working over their hours on on a weekly basis.

pros: Working for an organisation which has direct impact on the natural environment, like minded people, some of the most intelligent people I have ever met! Flexible working
cons: The subject matter and the pace...good GOD. As a project manager it is like wading through treacle trying to get anything done. Very traditionally run - very much like an old fashioned public sector - but your are advised to think/act in a futuristic way. That doesnt work. Also, it is much more about keeping the funders happy than the quality of the work.
